definition: v. to become less active, less intense, or less in amount
example: As I began my speech, my feelings of nervousness quickly abated.

definition: adj. existing purely in the mind; not representing actual reality
example: Julie had trouble understanding the appeal of the abstract painting.

definition: adj. extremely bad
example: I got an abysmal grade on my research paper!

definition: adv. in accordance with
example: All students must behave accordingly.

definition: n. the act of gaining a skill or possession of something
example: Language acquisition is easier for kids than it is for adults.

definition: v. to make suit a new purpose
v. to accommodate oneself to a new condition, setting, or situation
example: The US has adapted many foreign foods to better suit the tastes of Americans.
Dogs are known for their ability to quickly adapt to their environments.

definition: adj. having knowledge or skill (usu. in a particular area)
example: Beth loves playing the piano, but she's especially adept at the violin.

definition: adj. having sufficient qualifications to meet a specific task or purpose
example: Though his resume was adequate, the company doubted whether he'd be a good fit.

definition: n. the arrival or creation of something (usu. historic)
example: The world has never been the same since the advent of the light bulb.

definition: adj. relating to hostile opposition
example: An adversarial attitude will make you many enemies in life.

definition: n. someone who promotes or defends something
v. to defend or promote something (usu. a belief, theory, opinion, etc.)
example: I am an advocate for free higher education.
Environmental protesters often advocate for cleaner energy practices.

definition: adj. relating to beauty or refined taste
example: The aesthetic decorations at the wedding reception made you feel as if you were a character in a fairy tale.

definition: v. to be able to buy
v. to be able to spare
example: He's saving money so he can afford to buy a new car.
I can't afford to lose any more pencils!

definition: v. to promote something (usu. a cause)
example: They're agitating for better health care.

definition: v. to permit or consent to
example: US law allows citizens to speak freely.

definition: v. to make a secretive mention of something
example: She alluded to the problem at hand but didn't say anything more about it.

definition: n. a noisy argument or confrontation
example: Greg got into an altercation with a stranger at the bar.

definition: adj. unclear or vague in meaning
example: Her ambiguous statement made me question whether she could be trusted.

definition: adj. having a powerful desire for success or achievement
example: Penny is so ambitious, she wants to be president someday.

definition: n. the state of being uncertain or stuck between two or more options
example: His ambivalence prevented him from immediately signing the contract.

definition: adj. similar but not identical
example: Green onions are considered analogous to spring onions.

definition: v. to destroy or cause devastating destruction
example: The dictator sent orders to annihilate the group of rebels.

definition: n. something different from the norm
example: This result is an anomaly and very rarely happens.

definition: v. assume to be likely to happen
example: The party was just as fun as I had anticipated it would be.

definition: n. a strong feeling of dislike
example: Her antipathy toward the professor was obvious: she rolled her eyes whenever he entered the classroom.

definition: n. the highest point of something
example: The spring play was the apex of our school year.

definition: n. fearful expectation of something
example: Her apprehension to leave her house resulted in her missing the train.

definition: v. to clearly express in words
example: She articulated her opinion on the price of the house.

definition: adj. something made; not occurring naturally
example: Many candies use artificial flavors to make them taste fruity.

definition: n. a strong declaration
example: His assertion that sharks are mammals made everyone laugh.

definition: adj. extremely plain
adj. stern and forbidding
adj. relating to self-denial
example: He lived in a small, austere cabin in the middle of the woods.
My boss had an austere expression on her face.
An austere lifestyle, like that of monks, isn't for everybody.

definition: n. the quality of being real and true instead of fake and contrived
example: The police officer doubted the authenticity of the suspect's story.

definition: n. an intangible path or approach to something
example: The company has decided to pursue other avenues.

definition: adj. actively interested in or enthusiastic about something
example: Gerald is an avid soccer fan.

definition: adj. relating to the foundation or basis of something
example: You have to start with basic Russian before you can move on to the advanced level.

definition: v. to have as a characteristic
v. to have (a child)
v. to bring forth
v. to put up with
example: She bears a strong resemblance to your mother.
Judy will bear her first child later this year.
My garden is going to bear pumpkins this year.
I can't bear her complaining any longer!

definition: adj. kind, generous
example: Many cultures believe in benevolent spirits.

definition: n. a preconception that prevents objectivity
example: It's important to avoid bias when investigating a crime.

definition: adj. tinged with a feeling of sadness
example: The ending of the romance movie was bittersweet.

definition: v. to support, strengthen, or fortify
example: If we work together, we should be able to lift and then bolster the couch.

definition: n. an increase or growth
v. to increase or make grow
example: The boost in profits was a welcome change.
In order to boost profits, you need to cater to your customers.

definition: n. an intense, loud fight
v. to fight loudly and disruptively
example: A brawl broke out at school today after one student accused another of cheating.
The two students brawled for an hour.

definition: n. the quality of being brief or terse
example: The brevity of their time together made it all the more romantic.

definition: adj. direct, blunt
example: Josh is candid about his desire to become an actor.

definition: n. the trait of being honest and frank
example: I admire her candor, especially when nobody else bothers to speak up.

definition: v. to use to your advantage
example: I'd like to capitalize on your math skills by having your work the cash register.

definition: v. to trap or take possession of
v. to successfully represent or imitate
v. to captivate, mesmerize
v. to catch or seize
example: The spy was captured by the enemy.
Your painting beautifully captures the ephemerality of life.
I was captured by her beauty.
The cops captured the criminal three days after the incident.

definition: adj. relating to the city or citizens
example: Voting is a civic duty.

definition: adj. emotionally unattached (usu. used in medical or scientific setting)
example: Her clinical approach to situations allows her to handle them more effectively.

definition: n. special advantage or power
example: Children of rich and famous people often believe they have a lot of clout.

definition: adj. indicating a rough texture
adj. lacking refinement or sophistication
example: The horse's mane was coarse, as if it had never been washed.
The queen's coarse way of speaking surprised the other members of royalty.

definition: v. to happen at the same time
example: It wasn't until after I booked my ticket that I realized the concert coincided with my finals.

definition: n. the use of payment to request something (e.g., a service or product)
example: This painting was commissioned by a rich merchant in 1589.

definition: adj. able to be compared
example: This novel is comparable to Huckleberry Finn.

definition: adj. sufficiently qualified
example: We need to hire a competent web developer to create a good website for our company.

definition: adj. satisfied, with no desire to change or improve
example: Though he had never won any awards or even been published, he was complacent with his life as a poet.

definition: v. to make perfect or complete
example: This wine perfectly complements this platter of gourmet cheese.

definition: v. to be forced to agree or surrender
v. to admit to a transgression
example: With no chance of winning the battle, the army at last conceded.
Dan conceded to pranking his sister.

definition: v. to imagine or come up with
example: The plan to build the city was originally conceived in the early 1900s.

definition: v. to overlook, approve, or allow
example: She couldn't condone her daughter's rebellious behavior.

definition: adj. able to bring about or be suitable for
example: The noisy students hardly made the campus library conducive to studying.

definition: v. to control or manage
v. to behave a certain way
example: The group conducted their research abroad last year.
Be sure to conduct yourself accordingly.

definition: v. to share something secretive with someone
example: She confided all of her biggest secrets in her best friend.

definition: v. to put limits on; to restrict
example: We are going to confine the use of this drinking fountain.

definition: n. overall agreement
example: After weeks of debating, the panel finally came to a consensus.

definition: v. to form or compose (part of) something
example: The desire for equality constituted the civil rights movement.

definition: v. to think deeply about
example: She contemplated telling her teacher about the cheating student.

definition: v. to maintain or assert (an opinion)
example: The president contends that the US government will not negotiate with terrorists.

definition: v. to be in contrast with
example: The camera footage contradicts his alibi.

definition: adj. highly debatable and causing contention
example: Millions of viewers watched the controversial debate take place.

definition: adj. abiding by accepted standards
example: She lives a conventional life in the suburbs.

definition: v. to pass on or transfer (information)
example: I have trouble conveying my thoughts in French.

definition: n. a firm belief in something
example: Her religious convictions prevent her from eating meat.

definition: v. to provide evidence for; to back up (a claim)
example: The note signed by her father corroborates her claim that she was absent from class that day.

definition: v. to work in opposition to
example: This ingredient seems to counteract the other ones.

definition: n. an argument used to criticize or dismantle another argument
example: Make sure to include a counterargument in your essay so that you can show you've considered the topic from all perspectives.

definition: adj. hindering the achievement of a goal
example: Bill's idea to take a shortcut was ultimately counterproductive: it took us twice as long to get to the train station.

definition: n. the final act or climax
example: The culmination of the performance was unforgettable.

definition: v. to foster the growth of
example: Teachers don't just pass on new information to students—they cultivate their academic potential.

definition: v. to declare formally and with authority
example: The president decreed that Halloween would henceforth be a national holiday.

definition: n. respect; regard
example: Her deference to the elderly makes her the perfect candidate for an internship at the retirement center.

definition: adj. not enough in degree or amount
example: I feel as though the sources for my paper are deficient.

definition: v. to do as an example
v. gives evidence for
example: Could you demonstrate the dance move for me?
This book's use of words such as “grim” and “bleak” demonstrates the author's mournful tone.

definition: v. to object to
example: She demurred at my request to transfer to a different department.

definition: v. to (over)use over time (usu. resources)
example: The lost campers quickly depleted their supply of food.

definition: adj. bare, barren, empty
example: The moon is one giant, desolate landscape.

definition: v. to come up with (a plan)
example: Lana devised a plan to make herself famous.

definition: n. a problem, usually requiring a choice between two options
example: The main dilemma is whether to pay for a commercial or not.

definition: n. conscientiousness; the quality of being committed to a task
example: Diligence and confidence will get you far in life.

definition: v. to become smaller in scope or degree
example: The itchiness of mosquito bites usually starts to diminish after a few days.

definition: adj. hopeless and dangerous or fearful
example: When the police didn't explain what was happening right away, Jane knew that the situation must be dire.

definition: n. disagreement
example: Disputes over money caused intense discord in the family.

definition: n. a lack of respect and strong dislike (toward something or someone)
example: He looked at me with such disdain that I immediately knew the job wouldn't work out.

definition: n. hopelessness, stress, or consternation
v. to fill with woe or apprehension
example: To Nick's dismay, he got an F on the test.
Many were dismayed by the town's implementation of metered parking.

definition: v. to belittle or speak down to
example: A good boss is stern but never disparages his or her employees.

definition: v. to send off a message or messenger
example: The mother dispatched her daughter to their neighbor's house.

definition: n. the act of becoming diverse
example: Lately, there's been noticeable diversification of students at higher institutions.

definition: n. a principle, theory, or position, usu. advocated by a religion or gov't
example: Devoutly religious people often live their lives according to their doctrines.

definition: n. power and authority (usu. over a territory)
n. a legal territory
example: The country claimed to have dominion over parts of Russia.
Puerto Rico is a dominion of the US.

definition: adj. sad, gloomy, dull
example: The gray clouds in the sky made the day feel dreary.

definition: adj. doubtful, questionable
example: The man's claims to the throne were dubious since nobody knew where he'd come from.

definition: adj. peculiar or odd; deviating from the norm
example: She's a little eccentric but still fun to be around.

definition: adj. extremely bad
example: After cheating on the exam, Emily began to feel as though she'd made an egregious mistake.

definition: adj. having refined or expressive communication skills (in speaking or writing)
example: His speech was not only eloquent but also extremely compelling.

definition: adj. superior or distinguished; high in position or status
example: Our town made news when the eminent magician came to perform at our local theater.

definition: v. to discharge, give forth, or release
example: Plants consume carbon dioxide and emit oxygen.

definition: adj. very expressive; using emphasis
example: Her emphatic smile told me she was excited to ride the roller coaster.

definition: adj. derived from experience, observation, or an experiment
example: You need empirical evidence to support your claim.

definition: v. to equip or bestow (usu. a quality or ability)
example: According to the myth, the gods endowed him with the gift of healing.

definition: v. to withstand, sustain, or hold out against
example: I can't endure this wait any longer. Will Stanford accept or reject me?

definition: v. to involve or include
example: A doctoral program entails long nights and a heavy workload.

definition: adj. firmly established
example: Her face will forever be entrenched in my memory.

definition: v. to specify or count
example: I can't enumerate how many times I've had to remind my students when their papers are due.

definition: n. excessive jealousy
v. to admire and be jealous of
example: His envy of her is quite obvious.
She envies her coworker's social skills.

definition: adj. having no fixed course; deviating from the norm
example: The car became erratic after slipping on ice.

definition: v. to enact
v. to found (a business, group, school, etc.)
example: They established a law that made it illegal to drive after drinking any amount of alcohol.
Our group established a new branch in Chicago.

definition: v. to draw forth or call up
example: Horror movies are great at evoking fear.

definition: v. to make worse or increase the severity of
example: The doctor told me not to run as it can exacerbate my knee injury.

definition: v. to do something extremely well or to be superior in
example: She was a well-rounded student but excelled especially in science.

definition: v. to put into use (usu. as effort)
example: Don't exert all of your energy at once.

definition: adj. invigorating, stimulating, or exciting
example: The music playing at the club was catchy and exhilarating.

definition: v. to use up (as in energy or money)
example: Be careful not to expend all your energy in the first half of a marathon.

definition: v. to use selfishly or for profit
example: The shoddy company exploited its workers by paying them extremely low wages.

definition: v. to aid the progress of
example: In grad school, advisors facilitate students' research and offer constructive criticism.

definition: n. the practicality or possibility of something
example: The feasibility of her project was doubtful; she'd have to go all the way to Antarctica and back before the school year ended.

definition: n. viciousness, violence
example: The lion is just one wild animal known for its ferocity.

definition: adj. related to (government) money
example: Fiscal policy is how the government uses money to influence the economy.

definition: v. to prosper, grow, or make fast progress
example: After one year, the tiny plants had flourished into a breathtaking garden.

definition: v. to be unstable; to rise and fall
example: Stocks can fluctuate on a daily basis, making it difficult to determine when to buy or sell one.

definition: v. to stir up
example: The civilians accused their leader of fomenting political unrest.

definition: adj. capable of being predicted or anticipated
example: I can't imagine aliens visiting us in the foreseeable future.

definition: adv. directly, clearly
example: I frankly don't see the point in learning to drive.

definition: adj. carefree
example: His freewheeling attitude often got him in trouble at work.

definition: adj. the most essential or most basic part
example: A thesis is arguably the most fundamental part of an essay.

definition: adj. thrilling, exciting, stimulating
example: The galvanizing performance left everyone spellbound.

definition: adj. relating to old age
example: I became interested in geriatric medicine shortly after my grandfather passed away from cancer.

definition: adj. harmful, dangerous
example: The voices around the corner sounded angry, hostile even.

definition: adj. supposed; related to a hypothesis
example: For my physics homework, I must come up with a hypothetical situation.

definition: adj. publicly shameful or humiliating
example: The politician's expensive campaign ultimately ended in ignominious defeat.

definition: v. to transmit, bestow, or disclose
example: Parents must impart common sense to their children.

definition: n. the equal and objective treatment of opposing views
example: To ensure impartiality, we require everyone to follow these general guidelines.

definition: adj. impressive (esp. in size or appearance)
example: The old mansion was imposing in its huge size and gothic architecture.

definition: n. an unnecessary burden
example: If it's not too much of an imposition, could you proofread my paper?

definition: adj. not cautious or prudent; rash
example: Backpacking abroad can be fun, but don't be imprudent about money.

definition: v. to encourage or stir up
example: Her hateful words incited anger in the crowd.

definition: n. apathy, emotional detachment
example: The girl's indifference toward her brother upset their parents.

definition: adv. randomly; with little or no distinction
example: Lottery winners are chosen indiscriminately.

definition: v. to give into; to satisfy or gratify
example: My friend loves to indulge in cheesy romance movies.

definition: v. to guess, conclude, or derive by reasoning
example: You can infer from this quotation that the writer didn't care for “pretty” language.

definition: adj. novel or new (esp. as an idea or invention)
example: Her invention was incredibly innovative and won her multiple awards.

definition: adj. can't be satisfied
example: A vampire's thirst for blood is said to be insatiable.

definition: n. a reversal
example: The culture's norms were an inversion of our own.

definition: v. to call on; to appeal to (e.g., a higher power)
example: The shaman attempted to invoke a demon.

definition: adj. incapable of being in harmony or agreed upon
example: The couple's differences were ultimately irreconcilable, giving them no choice but to break up.

definition: v. to feel sorrow for; to mourn
example: Susan lamented her missed chance at going to Europe with her high school class.

definition: n. movement
example: Physics involves the study of locomotion.

definition: adj. capable of making a lot of money; profitable
example: Writing books isn't a particularly lucrative career, unless you're J.K. Rowling.

definition: adj. harmful, spiteful
example: The malicious spirit drove out the inhabitants from their home.

definition: adj. capable of being molded or changed
example: Children's minds are malleable but only for so long.

definition: adj. superficial; focus on material possessions
example: Many people accuse Americans of being materialistic.

definition: adj. extravagant or exaggerated (as of a melodrama)
example: The melodramatic play was well liked by the audience.

definition: adj. simple and humble
adj. small in size or amount
example: They moved into a modest house in the countryside.

definition: v. to change, alter, or tweak
example: Dr. Nguyen modified the gene so that it wouldn't carry the disease.

definition: adj. historically significant
example: Her win in the election was momentous.

definition: adj. new, innovative
example: We are looking for novel ways to approach the project.

definition: n. a subtle difference in meaning
example: Body-language experts even understand the nuances of facial expressions.

definition: adj. legally void and ineffective
example: The government declared their marriage null.

definition: n. judgment based on observations instead of emotions or opinions
example: In scientific research, objectivity is of utmost importance.

definition: adj. no longer used; rare or uncommon
example: Historians assumed record players would be obsolete by now, but in fact they're making a huge comeback.

definition: adj. almighty and all powerful
example: Gods are omnipotent beings who can control human destiny.

definition: n. the beginning or early stages
example: At the onset of her career as a lawyer, things were looking up.

definition: v. to openly express an opinion
example: The new employee opined at the company meeting.

definition: adj. highly detailed and decorated
example: That ornate silverware must be worth thousands of dollars!

definition: v. to remove or force out of (usu. a position or office)
example: Sick and tired of putting up with his bad moods, the pirates ousted their captain.

definition: adj. predominant, superior, most important
example: Our paramount concern is the safety of our employees.

definition: adj. strange, bizarre
example: Upon entering the abandoned house, Kate experienced a peculiar feeling, as if someone was watching her.

definition: v. to die; to pass away
example: According to the news, nobody perished in the fire.

definition: v. to cause suffering to
example: They will persecute anyone who doesn't agree with their views of the world.

definition: adj. cranky, pouty, irritable
example: Petulant children are especially difficult to care for.

definition: n. highest level or degree
example: Many believe that composers such as Beethoven and Mozart represent the pinnacle of classical music.

definition: adj. deserving pity
example: The frail-looking dog was pitiable, so I gave it some food and took it inside to care for it.

definition: adj. reasonable and possibly true
example: Her story is plausible, but that doesn't mean she's telling the truth.

definition: v. to assert
example: The literary critic postulates that romanticism and naturalism are actually interconnected.

definition: adj. having great influence
adj. having a strong, chemical effect
example: The bald eagle is a potent symbol of the US.
The potion was definitely potent—it healed my wounds immediately!

definition: adj. practical, useful
example: It's not necessarily more pragmatic to study engineering than it is to study philosophy.

definition: n. an example or subject from earlier in time
example: This change in law is without historical precedent.

definition: n.  someone who comes before you (usu. in position or office)
example: My predecessor gave me many tips for running the office.

definition: v. to command orders
v. to issue authorization for medications
example: The directions for our essay prescribe a length of at least ten pages.

definition: n. basic truth, assumption, or rule
example: Remember the universal principle: treat others as you want them to treat you.

definition: v. to command against, to outlaw
example: Alcohol was prohibited in the US in the 1920s.

definition: adj. punctual, on time
n. a cue to begin something; instructions
v. to incite, propel, or cause to act
example: She is always prompt when it comes to turning in her homework.
I had to write an essay based on a prompt.
The possibility of a scholarship prompted him to apply to Harvard.

definition: v. to put into law or formally declare
example: The ruler will at last promulgate an amnesty with the neighboring countries.

definition: v. to bring criminal action against someone (in a trial)
example: The suspect was prosecuted yesterday.

definition: adj. intending to provoke, inspire, or arouse
example: Her nude paintings are considered quite provocative.

definition: adj. involving qualities of something (features and content)
example: I noticed a qualitative change in her paintings.

definition: adj. involving quantities (numbers and amounts)

definition: n. a strange habit
example: His biggest quirk is his love of old marbles.

definition: v. to split into two or more branches
example: Cars ramified throughout the world in the twentieth century.

definition: adj. without attention to danger or risk
example: Her rash decision to pass the car nearly resulted in a crash.

definition: adj. unrefined
adj. not processed; uncooked (as in food)

definition: adv. right away and without difficulty
example: Water was readily available at different points in the race.

definition: n. thinking again about a previously made choice
example: The judges' reconsideration of her performance resulted in her victory.

definition: n. a change for the better; improvement

definition: v. to prove to be untrue, unfounded, or incorrect
example: The student refuted the professor's claim in class.

definition: v. to strengthen or add support to
example: We can use these pipes to reinforce the structure.

definition: adv. somewhat unwillingly
example: Max reluctantly agreed to see the horror movie with his friends.

definition: v. to give up (usu. power or a position)
v. to cast off

definition: v. to refuse to recognize as true
v. to cast off
example: The father repudiated his son's marriage.

definition: n. the act of keeping something
example: Water retention can make you weigh more on certain days.

definition: adj. satisfied (usu. in hunger)
example: I felt satiated after eating a snack.

definition: adj. having practical intelligence or knowledge

definition: adj. morally offensive, often causing damage to one's reputation

definition: adj. paying great attention to detail

definition: v. to produce or release (a substance)

definition: n. opinion

example: I am of the sentiment that you should never give out your passwords to anyone.

definition: adj. so thin that light can shine through

definition: adj. easy; not complex
adj. undecorated

definition: adj. ominous, evil

definition: adv. insufficiently, meagerly, or in a restricted manner

definition: v. to stimulate or incite

definition: adj. run-down, sordid, or sleazy
example: The squalid cabin needed a new roof and an exterminator.

definition: adj. very plain; devoid of any details or features
example: Looking out at the stark landscape, I felt a keen sense of isolation.

definition: adj. motionless
adj. changeless
example: The ball is static.

definition: adv. happening later or after something
example: I subsequently went home.

definition: adj. very large in amount or degree
example: I was shocked to find a substantial amount of money beneath the park bench.

definition: adj. hard to detect or analyze

definition: adj. skilled at dealing with people

definition: adj. pulled tight

definition: adj. abundantly filled (usu. with living organisms)

definition: n. usual mood or feelings
example: She had a hostile temperament, making her intimidating to most people.

definition: adj. not yet finalized

definition: adj. see-through; so thin that light can shine through

definition: adj. dangerous and unstable
example: The journey was becoming treacherous, but they continued on regardless.

definition: adj. very large, good, or bad in degree or size
example: Tremendous news! You don't have to repay your loans!

definition: adj. being everywhere at once
example: Cell phones are ubiquitous these days.

definition: adj. undecorated, plain
example: Though the dress was cheap and unadorned, it was by far her favorite one on the rack.

definition: v. to weaken or subvert (usu. gradually or secretly)
example: Parents should take care not to constantly undermine their children.

definition: v. to emphasize or give additional weight to
example: This sentence seems to underscore the overall meaning of the passage.

definition: v. to move as ripples or in a wavy pattern
example: Belly dancers are known for their ability to skillfully undulate their stomachs.

definition: adj. one-sided
example: The unilateral decision was deemed unfair by the other party involved.

definition: adj. unfair; not justified
example: The court's decision is unjust—he should not go free.

definition: adj. downright, utter, total
example: My speech was an unmitigated disaster!

definition: adj. completely new and never having happened before; historic
example: The number of protestors was unprecedented.

definition: v. to make visible; to reveal
example: We plan to unveil our plans for the new company project on Sunday.

definition: n. desire or impulse
v. to encourage or persuade
example: He had the urge to tell his parents about his acceptance to Columbia but decided against it.
She urged her sister to apply to Stanford.

definition: v. to prove or declare valid
example: Your selfish actions do not validate your feelings for me.

definition: n. ability to be done in a practical or useful way
example: The viability of the solution is questionable.

definition: adj. urgently necessary
example: It is vital that you respond by the deadline.

definition: v. to promise
example: My brother quickly broke his vow to never eat chocolate again.

definition: v. to prove to be reasonable
example: Wanting to look cool in front of your friends doesn't warrant breaking the law.

definition: n. production of an amount
v. to give way to or surrender to
v. to produce or supply
example: The farmer's annual pumpkin yield exceeded 10,000.
Cars turning right on red must yield to oncoming traffic.
Our experiment yielded many unique-looking vegetables.
